name: All the title block fields filled with appropriate information through parameters only
description: Check all the title block fields filled with appropriate information through parameters only (through i-properties)​
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Right-click on the title block and select 'Edit Definition'.
In the title block editor, identify all the fields that need to be filled with information.
Close the title block editor.
Go to the 'Manage' tab and select 'iProperties'.
In the iProperties dialog, navigate through the tabs (Summary, Project, Status, Custom) to ensure all relevant information is filled in.
Check that each title block field is linked to the corresponding iProperty parameter.
If any field is not linked or filled, update the iProperties accordingly.
Save the changes and close the iProperties dialog.
Verify that the title block fields are now correctly populated with the appropriate information from the iProperties.

name: Check Autodesk Inventor Version to be used.
description: Check version "Autodesk Inventor Professional 2022" is available
logicalSteps: Open Autodesk Inventor.
Go to the 'Help' menu.
Select 'About Autodesk Inventor'.
Check the version number displayed in the 'About' window.
Confirm if the version is 'Autodesk Inventor Professional 2022'.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Check Blank Number
description: Check blank number present in the title block
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
In the Model Tree, locate the Title Block section.
Expand the Title Block section to view all the fields.
Search for the 'Blank Number' field.
If the field is present, confirm the check passes.
If the field is absent, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Check Drawing Title Block of below points -
description:
ORIGINAL SCALE, DRN, DATE, TECHNICAL, APPR'D, SIZE, COMPONENT(Description),
 DRAWING NUMBER, ISSUE ( Revision Number)
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
In the Model Tree, locate the Title Block section.
Expand the Title Block section to view all the fields.
Verify the presence of the following fields: ORIGINAL SCALE, DRN, DATE, TECHNICAL, APPR'D, SIZE, COMPONENT (Description), DRAWING NUMBER, ISSUE (Revision Number).
If all fields are present, confirm the check passes.
If any field is absent, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Check Owner Name
description: Check drawing owner is mentioned in title block & its correct
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Locate the title block in the drawing.
Identify the section of the title block where the owner's name is mentioned.
Verify that the owner's name is present and correctly spelled.
If the owner's name is correct, confirm the check passes.
If the owner's name is incorrect or missing, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Check sheet size appropriate for information visibility
description: Sheet size is used either A3, A2 & A1 or A0​
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Go to the 'Sheet' tab in the ribbon.
Select 'Edit Sheet' from the options.
Check the current sheet size in the 'Sheet' dialog box.
Ensure the sheet size is either A3, A2, A1, or A0.
If the sheet size is appropriate, confirm the check passes.
If the sheet size is not appropriate, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Check the COG and weight on drawing.
description: Net mass is mentioned in the given drawing as per AC standards​. Centre of gravity is mentioned with symbol and dimensions on any two views on the drawing​.
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
In the Model Tree, locate the Annotations section.
Expand the Annotations section to view all the placed annotations.
Search for the 'Net Mass' annotation and verify it is mentioned as per AC standards.
Locate the views on the drawing.
Check for the Centre of Gravity (COG) symbol and its dimensions on any two views.
If both the Net Mass and COG are present and correctly annotated, confirm the check passes.
If either the Net Mass or COG is absent or incorrectly annotated, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Ensure standard scale is applied for all views in drawing​
description: Check if any other view is having different scale than that of base view, if so view heading in drawing area has any one of the following values : 1:1, 1:2, 1:5, 1:10, 1:20, 1:50, 2:1. 5:1, 10:1
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Select the base view in the drawing.
Note the scale of the base view.
Select each additional view in the drawing.
Compare the scale of each additional view to the base view.
If any view has a different scale, check if the scale is one of the standard values: 1:1, 1:2, 1:5, 1:10, 1:20, 1:50, 2:1, 5:1, 10:1.
If all views adhere to the standard scales, confirm the check passes.
If any view does not adhere to the standard scales, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Is relevant scale mentioned to the views which are different than main scale
description:
Check Purpose:
To check whether view scale (scale of view properties) is as per standard or not. ​

Pass Condition​:
If views are having scale among (1:1, 1:2, 1:5, 1:10, 1:20, 1:50, 1:100, 2:1, 5:1, 10:1)​

Fail Condition​:
If any of the above-mentioned pass condition is not matched
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: Is standard 2D template used to create the drawing ​
description: Rule passed when Atlas Copco template is used.
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Navigate to the 'Manage' tab on the ribbon.
Select 'Styles and Standards Editor' from the 'Styles and Standards' panel.
In the 'Styles and Standards Editor' dialog, check the 'Standard' dropdown menu.
Verify that the 'Atlas Copco' template is selected.
If the 'Atlas Copco' template is selected, confirm the rule passes.
If a different template is selected, confirm the rule fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Is table of design or test pressure with the exact values shown in drawing​
description: Check text for "Design pressure" or "Test pressure" to check values in table
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Locate the table that contains the design and test pressure values.
Identify the cells or rows labeled 'Design pressure' and 'Test pressure'.
Verify the values in these cells match the exact values specified in the drawing.
If the values match, confirm the check passes.
If the values do not match, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Is the physical file name as per AC standard
description: For 13 or 14 digit, 10 numeric characters and “-” with trailing 12th alphanumeric character and 13th or 14th digit as numeric again.​ Correct part numbers:  1903001122-01, 1830045236-M1​.
logicalSteps: Open the part or assembly file in Autodesk Inventor.
Go to the File menu and select 'Save As' to view the current file name.
Check if the file name follows the AC standard: 13 or 14 digits, with 10 numeric characters, a '-' at the 12th position, and the 13th or 14th character as numeric.
Compare the file name against the examples provided (e.g., 1903001122-01, 1830045236-M1).
If the file name matches the standard, confirm the check passes.
If the file name does not match the standard, confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: M-17 Checking material assigned with Atlas Copco 10digit number in title block​
description:
If drawing  have a material assigned in title block in 10digit number. ​

If drawing have a material assigned in title block as “ See drawing” & material information added in notes in drawing.​

If in part list material assigned in 10digit number or  “See drawing” or “See Standard”.​
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-18 Material comment added ( T for thickness) if not dimensioned​
description:
If a material comment is added, T for thickness, Ø for diameter in the part list comments column.​

If T=xx added in the title block in the material extra description​.
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-19 Check treatment assigned in title block​
description:
If drawing has a treatment assigned in title block as 10 digit number​.
If Treatment is mentioned in the text in the treatment column in the title block.​
If the drawing has a treatment assigned in the title block as “ See drawing” & treatment added in notes in the drawing.​
If in the treatment table, the treatment is mentioned in 10digit or RAL number
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-20 Check treatment see drawing
description: If treatment is mentioned as “See Drawing” in the title block. For the drawing where the part list is given on drawing with R/S column has values as R & S only​
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-22 Latest edition of Atlas Copco template used
description: Pass Condition​: If the latest template is used for drawing​. IF version drawing is mentioned in the template​. IF Two columns with Owning unit and Transferred from are present in the template​
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Navigate to the 'Manage' tab and select 'Styles Editor'.
In the Styles Editor, locate the 'Drawing Resources' section.
Expand the 'Drawing Resources' section and select 'Title Blocks'.
Check if the latest edition of the Atlas Copco template is listed and used.
Verify that the version of the drawing is mentioned in the template.
Ensure that the template includes two columns labeled 'Owning unit' and 'Transferred from'.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: M-26 -  Check standard scale used​
description:
If the standard scale is used for all main, section, detail, and projected views.​
If the standard scale is used for the main sheet in the title block.
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet

description: Checking "R/S" column is given in part list and the "R/S" marking is correctly mentioned

name: M-43 Standard Parts material must have "See Standards"
description: If any part number in the part list is Standard part, then in the Material column the material is mentioned as “see standards”​
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document

name: M-48 Check that Part numbers and Qty are not manually overwritten
description: If Part numbers and Qty are not manually overwritten​
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements

name: M-49 Check if drawing made for standard part​
description:
Pass Condition: If drawing is made for Item which is defined by only “-” in “R/S” in Parameter manager/ENOVIA.​
If details of item added on drawing which is defined by only  “-” in “R/S” in Part list.​
Fail Condition:
If drawing is made for Item which is defined by only “S” in “R/S” in Parameter manager.​
If details of item added on drawing which is defined by only  “S” in “R/S” in Part list.​
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Navigate to the Parameter Manager.
Locate the 'R/S' parameter for the item in question.
Check if the 'R/S' parameter is defined by only '-'.
If the 'R/S' parameter is '-', confirm the check passes.
If the 'R/S' parameter is 'S', confirm the check fails.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: M-50 Checking the finished weight present in the title block
description: Ensure correct weight is shown in drawing.
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-56 Check compare and replaces is mentioned in title block
description: Replace number or compare number should be is there in title block.​
logicalSteps: Get the drawing document
Get the active sheet
Get the sketch symbols
Get the texts from sketch symbols
Compare to list elements
Combine object status
Get rule status

name: M-57 Check edition is available for all item numbers of a tabular drawing
description: Pass Condition​: If editions are mentioned in the table in the Edition column​. If editions are correctly mentioned in the table as per the rules of tabular drawing​
logicalSteps: Open the tabular drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Locate the table that lists all item numbers.
Identify the 'Edition' column within the table.
Verify that each item number has an edition mentioned in the 'Edition' column.
Ensure the editions are correctly mentioned as per the rules of tabular drawing.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: M-59 Check brand logo in template - supplier parts/Manufacturing parts - AC logo
description: There should not be "Atlas Copco" logo in title block for dimension drawing, installation drawing, some instruction drawing or these drawings can have owned brand
logicalSteps: Open the 2D drawing in Autodesk Inventor.
Navigate to the title block area of the drawing.
Inspect the title block for the presence of the 'Atlas Copco' logo.
If the 'Atlas Copco' logo is present, confirm the check fails.
If the 'Atlas Copco' logo is absent, confirm the check passes.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).

name: Material Change-Modification Text​
description: Pass Condition​ : Modification Text should not be blank​. Revision number should be greater than 1.​ If modification text has “Material” word in it, then the format should be​ "Material was” followed by ‘AC 10-digit material number’.​
logicalSteps: Open the part or assembly file in Autodesk Inventor.
Navigate to the iProperties by right-clicking on the file in the Model Tree and selecting 'iProperties'.
Go to the 'Summary' tab and check the 'Modification Text' field.
Ensure the 'Modification Text' field is not blank.
Switch to the 'Project' tab and verify that the 'Revision Number' is greater than 1.
In the 'Modification Text' field, check if the word 'Material' is present.
If 'Material' is present, ensure the format is 'Material was' followed by the 'AC 10-digit material number'.
Document the result of the check (Pass or Fail).
